page.title: 05The Central Library
page.content: The Central Library is off Homer Road. It was opened in 1976, it had cost Â£1.4 million to build. It has got 60,000 books on two floors. It has its own theatre and activity room. The upper floor has a local history section and a study area. It also has an audio visual department which lends records, cassettes and framed pictures. The coffee bar has views over the library forecourt and landscaped inner court. There is an art gallery and exhibition hall in which work from schools and local organisations is displayed regularly.
